maybe the lactase persistence gene carriers where better able to survive the cold grey of UK and such because they could drink more animal milk and therefore get more calcium. The would have needed optimal amounts of calcium because they may have had less vitamin D to help absorb it.
meanwhile the Early humans in Asia and Africa got loads of sun and probably produce loads of vitamin d so they can get all the calcium they need from other foods without that extra dairy.
I wonder if this gene appeared before or after European skin started getting lighter? even now many people in the UK especially in the north are low in vitamin D even those of fairer skin which should be able to make more vit d with the limited sunshine than dark skin.

I know reeces puffs aren't flat so I spit it back to the cup and from the Light from my phone it looked like a dead roach. my heart stopped (not literal). I just ate a dead roach I said to myself in my head.  I didn't exactly felted disgusted but my throat felted voiolated.
